name: daisy chain shawl
notes:
the triangular pattern is designed to repeat, so you can continue the repeating pattern until the desired size of shawl is achieved. 

the rectangular repeating pattern can be used for anything from a rectangle shawl, pillow/cushion cover, table runner, table cloth, placemat, dresser cover, or as a larger item for across the end of the bed.

this pattern is for beginning to intermediate crocheters.

there are small charts in each row of the written pattern to assist with visualising the order of stitches on one side of the shawl and the placement of stitches relative to the row below.

photos of each row are also in the document.

pattern alternates between flower lacework and a chain pattern.
